com.guidewire.ab.webservices.api

Interface ILoginAPI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ILoginAPISoapBindingStub

    public interface ILoginAPI
extends java.rmi.Remote

    A remote interface that allows a user to log in and out of a system. The system uses conversations to implement SOAP authentication in a Guidewire application (e.g. BillingCenter, ClaimCenter, PolicyCenter). When connecting to Guidewire applications the caller must first authenticate using the ILoginAPI.login() method. This method returns the the session ID of the server session.

    On each successive call in the conversation, pass the session ID in the SOAP header gw.pl.util.webservices.Globals#GW_AUTHENTICATION_SECURITY_TOKEN_CONTEXT_PROPERTY. You must call logout() when you are done with the conversation.

    NOTE: This API is intended for users who are using Guidewire's web services from languages other than Java. If you are using Java, you should use the APILocator instead.

    • Method Detail

      • WSSLogin

        java.lang.String WSSLogin(java.lang.String userName,
                        java.lang.String password)
                          throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                 ServerStateException,
                                 PermissionException,
                                 SOAPException,
                                 BadIdentifierException,
                                 LoginException

        Logs the user in preparation for a Web Service Security (WSS) conversation. A WSS conversation is one in which user credentials are passed using the WSS UsernameToken profile.

        NOTE: The Guidewire Toolkit does not currently support this method. This method is available for access by all other SOAP clients.

        Parameters:
        userName -
        password -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ServerStateException - Thrown when a request is made at a time the server is in a state that disallows the request.
        PermissionException - Thrown when the authenticated SOAP user does not have permission to perform the requested operation
        SOAPException
        BadIdentifierException - Thrown when an internal public ID doesn't map to a real bean (problem could be that type was incorrect)
        LoginException - if the user cannot be authenticated or was denied access for some reason.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if a communication error occurs

      • WSSLogout

        void WSSLogout(java.lang.String userName)
               throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                      ServerStateException,
                      PermissionException,
                      SOAPException,
                      BadIdentifierException
        Terminates a WSS conversation. Attempts to log out a user not logged in are siltently ignored.

        NOTE: Usage of this method by the Guidewire Toolkit is not currently supported. This is available for access by all other SOAP clients.

        Parameters:
        userName -
        Throws:
        ServerStateException - Thrown when a request is made at a time the server is in a state that disallows the request.
        PermissionException - Thrown when the authenticated SOAP user does not have permission to perform the requested operation
        SOAPException
        BadIdentifierException - Thrown when an internal public ID doesn't map to a real bean (problem could be that type was incorrect)
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if a communication error occurs

      • login

        java.lang.String login(java.lang.String userName,
                     java.lang.String password)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                              ServerStateException,
                              PermissionException,
                              SOAPException,
                              BadIdentifierException,
                              LoginException
        Logs the user into a Guidewire application (e.g. ClaimCenter, PolicyCenter, BillingCenter). Returns the session ID of the server session.
        Parameters:
        userName - The user name to authenticate.
        password - The password to authenticate with.
        Returns:
        A valid session ID.
        Throws:
        ServerStateException - Thrown when a request is made at a time the server is in a state that disallows the request.
        PermissionException - Thrown when the authenticated SOAP user does not have permission to perform the requested operation
        SOAPException
        BadIdentifierException - Thrown when an internal public ID doesn't map to a real bean (problem could be that type was incorrect)
        LoginException - if the user cannot be authenticated or was denied access for some reason.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if a communication error occurs

      • logout

        void logout(java.lang.String sessionID)
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                   ServerStateException,
                   PermissionException,
                   SOAPException,
                   BadIdentifierException
        Logs the user out of the session. The session will timeout if this method is not called.
        Parameters:
        sessionID - the session ID of the server session.
        Throws:
        ServerStateException - Thrown when a request is made at a time the server is in a state that disallows the request.
        PermissionException - Thrown when the authenticated SOAP user does not have permission to perform the requested operation
        SOAPException
        BadIdentifierException - Thrown when an internal public ID doesn't map to a real bean (problem could be that type was incorrect)
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if a communication error occurs
